history.proof: unfold divide, is_ring in *. intros Hring. destruct Hring as [Hcomm [Hgroup [Hintern [Hassoc Hdist]]]]. split. - shelve. - split. + shelve. + left. shelve.

exceptions.exn: Wrong bullet -: Current bullet - is not finished.
Wrong bullet +: Current bullet + is not finished.

In environment S : Set A : S -> Prop Add, Mult : S -> S -> S O, I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat Hcomm : commutativity S Add Hgroup : is_group S A Add O Opp Hintern : intern S A Mult Hassoc : associativity S Mult Hdist : distributivity S Add Mult Unable to unify "?x = ?x \\/ ?B" with "O = O".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
S: Set
A: S -> Prop
Mult: S -> S -> S
Add: S -> S -> S
I: S
O: S
Opp: S -> S
v: S -> nat

Goal:
is_ring -> divide O O

Premises:
is_ring = commutativity S Add /\ is_group S A Add O Opp /\ intern S A Mult /\ associativity S Mult /\ distributivity S Add Mult : Prop
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments Datatypes.S _%nat_scope
divide = fun a b : S => A a /\ A b /\ (b = O \/ a <> O /\ (exists q : S, A q /\ b = Mult a q)) : S -> S -> Prop
VectorDef.fold_right2 : (?A -> ?B -> ?C -> ?C) -> ?C -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n -> ?C where ?A : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- Type] ?B : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- Type] ?C : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- Type]
VectorDef.rect2 : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n -> Type, P 0 (VectorDef.nil ?A) (VectorDef.nil ?B) -> (forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 -> forall (a : ?A) (b : ?B), P (Datatypes.S n) (VectorDef.cons ?A a n v1) (VectorDef.cons ?B b n v2)) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 where ?A : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- Type] ?B : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S ->...-> nat |- Type]
is_opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> S -> Prop
opp_unicity : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall x y : S, is_opposite S G Add O x y -> y = Opp x
opp_opp : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall x : S, G x -> x = Opp (Opp x)
neutral : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> Prop
distributivity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
is_group : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> (S -> S) -> Prop
opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> (S -> S) -> Prop
regular_l : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall y z : S, G y -> G z -> forall x : S, G x -> Add x y = Add x z -> y = z
commutativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
associativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
intern : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
is_unitary_commutative_ring = is_ring /\ commutativity S Mult /\ neutral S A Mult I : Prop
mult_O : is_ring -> forall x : S, A x -> Mult x O = O /\ Mult O x = O
Inductive ascii : Set := Ascii : bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> Ascii.ascii Arguments Ascii.Ascii (_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _)%bool_scope
mult_opp_l : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult (Opp x) y = Opp (Mult x y)
mult_opp_opp : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult (Opp x) (Opp y) = Mult x y
mult_opp_r : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult x (Opp y) = Opp (Mult x y)
Inductive Mon : Set := mon0 : Ring_polynom.Mon | zmon : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Mon | vmon : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Mon Arguments Ring_polynom.zmon _%positive_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.vmon _%positive_scope
Ring_polynom.PNSubst1 : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> C * Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> nat -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.POneSubst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> C * Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> option (Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Ring_polynom.PNSubstL : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> nat -> nat -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.PSubstL : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> nat -> option (Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Inductive string : Set := EmptyString : String.string | String : Ascii.ascii -> String.string -> String.string Arguments String.String _%char_scope
Bvector.Bvector = Vector.t bool : nat -> Set Arguments Bvector.Bvector _%nat_scope
Inductive positive : Set := xI : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive | xO : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive | xH : BinNums.positive Arguments BinNums.xI _%positive_scope Arguments BinNums.xO _%positive_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : BinNums.Z | Zpos : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z | Zneg : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinNums.Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments BinNums.Zneg _%positive_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.max_case_strong : forall (n m : nat) (P : nat -> Type), (m <= n -> P n) -> (n <= m -> P m) -> P (PeanoNat.Nat.max n m)
PeanoNat.Nat.min_case_strong : forall (n m : nat) (P : nat -> Type), (n <= m -> P n) -> (m <= n -> P m) -> P (PeanoNat.Nat.min n m)
PeanoNat.Nat.strong_right_induction : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : nat, (forall n : nat, z <= n -> (forall m : nat, z <= m -> m < n -> A m) -> A n) -> forall n : nat, z <= n -> A n
PeanoNat.Nat.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
Relation_Definitions.relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relation_Definitions.relation _%type_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.case_analysis : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A 0 -> (forall n : nat, A (Datatypes.S n)) -> forall n : nat, A n
Inductive Pol (C : Type) : Type := Pc : C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C | Pinj : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C | PX : Ring_polynom.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C Arguments Ring_polynom.Pol _%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.Pc [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.Pinj [C]%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PX [C]%type_scope _ _%positive_scope
Inductive N : Set := N0 : BinNums.N | Npos : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNums.Npos _%positive_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.max_case : forall (n m : nat) (P : nat -> Type), P n -> P m -> P (PeanoNat.Nat.max n m)
List.firstn : forall A : Type, nat -> list A -> list A
VectorDef.Forall2_sind : forall (A B : Type) (P : A -> B -> Prop) (P0 : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t B n -> SProp), P0 0 (VectorDef.nil A) (VectorDef.nil B) -> (forall (m : nat) (x1 : A) (x2 : B) (v1 : VectorDef.t A m) (v2 : VectorDef.t B m), P x1 x2 -> VectorDef.Forall2 P v1 v2 -> P0 m v1 v2 -> P0 (Datatypes.S m) (VectorDef.cons A x1 m v1) (VectorDef.cons B x2 m v2)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t A n) (t0 : VectorDef.t B n), VectorDef.Forall2 P t t0 -> P0 n t t0
VectorDef.Forall2_ind : forall (A B : Type) (P : A -> B -> Prop) (P0 : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t B n -> Prop), P0 0 (VectorDef.nil A) (VectorDef.nil B) -> (forall (m : nat) (x1 : A) (x2 : B) (v1 : VectorDef.t A m) (v2 : VectorDef.t B m), P x1 x2 -> VectorDef.Forall2 P v1 v2 -> P0 m v1 v2 -> P0 (Datatypes.S m) (VectorDef.cons A x1 m v1) (VectorDef.cons B x2 m v2)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t A n) (t0 : VectorDef.t B n), VectorDef.Forall2 P t t0 -> P0 n t t0

``` 
unfold divide, is_ring in *. intros Hring. destruct Hring as [Hcomm [Hgroup [Hintern [Hassoc Hdist]]]].
unfold divide. split.
- exact Hgroup.
- split.
  + exact Hgroup.
  + left. exact (or_introl eq_refl).
```
